curam.common.util.xml.dom.output

Class CustomXMLWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xml.sax.helpers.XMLFilterImpl
      • org.dom4j.io.XMLWriter
        • curam.common.util.xml.dom.output.CustomXMLWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.xml.sax.ContentHandler, org.xml.sax.DTDHandler, org.xml.sax.EntityResolver, org.xml.sax.ErrorHandler, org.xml.sax.ext.LexicalHandler, org.xml.sax.XMLFilter, org.xml.sax.XMLReader

    public class CustomXMLWriter
extends org.dom4j.io.XMLWriter
    A subclass of dom4j's XMLWriter. Overrides methods for writing Comment and Text nodes.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class org.dom4j.io.XMLWriter

        DEFAULT_FORMAT, lastOutputNodeType, LEXICAL_HANDLER_NAMES, preserve, writer

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void writeComment(java.lang.String text)
      Modifies behaviour of XMLWriter.writeComment(String) method to always start comments on a new line.
      protected void writeString(java.lang.String text)
      Modifies behaviour of XMLWriter.writeString(String) to behave like JDom's TRIM_FULL_WHITE TextMode.

      • writeComment

        protected void writeComment(java.lang.String text)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Modifies behaviour of XMLWriter.writeComment(String) method to always start comments on a new line.
        Overrides:
        writeComment in class org.dom4j.io.XMLWriter
        Parameters:
        text - the comment to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error

      • writeString

        protected void writeString(java.lang.String text)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Modifies behaviour of XMLWriter.writeString(String) to behave like JDom's TRIM_FULL_WHITE TextMode. The text is trimmed when it consists of nothing but whitespace but otherwise the output is unchanged.
        Overrides:
        writeString in class org.dom4j.io.XMLWriter
        Parameters:
        text - the string to write
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - on error.
